question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration purposes.
Please help me implement this SVG image using code. The rocket ship launched into space.

checklist.title: Is the rocket ship SVG properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG code correctly defines a rocket ship with appropriate shapes (body, windows, fins, etc.). Examine whether the geometric elements are properly constructed with correct coordinates and dimensions. Score 0 if no rocket is visible, 5 if basic shapes are present but disproportionate, and 10 if the rocket has proper proportions and identifiable components.

checklist.title: Is the space/sky background effectively created?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of the space/sky background. Check for stars, planets, or gradient backgrounds that convey outer space. Deduct 5 points if the background is plain or missing, 3 points if it lacks depth or context, and 2 points if the stars or elements are too uniform. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the rocket launch animation implemented?
checklist.description: Verify that the code includes animation for the rocket launching into space. Assess if the motion path is realistic (upward trajectory, possible slight curve), if there's proper easing (acceleration/deceleration), and if the animation duration is appropriate. Deduct 5 points if there's no animation, 3 points for jerky movement, and 2 points for unrealistic timing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are additional launch effects (fire/smoke/particles) included?
checklist.description: Examine whether the implementation includes proper visual effects for the rocket launch, such as exhaust flames, smoke trails, or particle effects. These should change dynamically during the launch sequence. Deduct 5 points if effects are missing entirely, 3 points if they're static, and 2 points if they lack variation or realism. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle different viewports, browser compatibility, and prevent rendering issues. Check for fallbacks or error handling. Code with strong robustness should work across modern browsers and scales appropriately. Give 10 points for comprehensive robustness, 5 points for average handling, and 0 points if major compatibility issues exist.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive elements that respond to user input 2. Day/night cycle in the background 3. Parallax scrolling for stars/planets). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or groups that serve no purpose 2. Excessive or overlapping animations 3. Overly complex effects that impact performance without adding value. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core animation is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating SVG structure from animations), code organization, and reusability. Deduct 5 points if all styles are inline rather than grouped; deduct 5 points if there's excessive code duplication; deduct 5 points if there's no separation between structure and behavior. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the rocket and space scene follow visual design principles: 1) Color harmony and appropriate contrast 2) Balanced proportions and composition 3) Attention to detail in the rocket and environment. Deduct 3 points for each visual perspective error, 5 points for clashing colors, and 5 points for poor composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and natural?
checklist.description: Judge whether the animations conform to physical motion principles: 1) Appropriate acceleration/deceleration 2) Natural movement paths 3) Smooth transitions between animation phases. Deduct 5 points for jarring motion, 3 points for unnatural timing, and 5 points for animation jumps or resets. The full score is 10 points.
